sentences.text: March 30, 2017
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Dear Fellow Stockholders,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We cordially invite you to attend our 2017 Annual Meeting of Stockholders to be held on Tuesday, May 16, 2017, at 2:00 p.m.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Pacific Time.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The annual meeting will be held at www.schwabevents.com/corporation, or you also may attend in person at 211 Main Street, San Francisco, California.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Please follow the registration instructions as outlined in this proxy statement to attend the meeting either virtually via the internet or in person.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: At the annual meeting, we will conduct the items of business outlined in this proxy statement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We also will report on our corporate performance in 2016 and answer your questions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Your vote is important.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We encourage you to read this proxy statement carefully and to vote your shares as soon as possible, even if you plan to attend the meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Voting instructions are contained on the proxy card or voting instruction form that you received with this proxy statement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We look forward to your participation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Sincerely,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: CHARLES R. SCHWAB CHAIRMAN
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: WALTER W. BETTINGER II PRESIDENT AND CHIEF EXECUTIVE OFFICER

sentences.text: Frequency of Advisory Vote on Executive Compensation
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: You will have the opportunity this year to indicate your preference on the frequency of having advisory votes on named executive officer compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: You may indicate your preference to have the advisory vote every one, two or three years, or you may abstain from voting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We recommend a frequency of one year for having advisory votes on named executive officer compensation, as we believe that having an advisory vote every year on named executive officer compensation provides the Compensation Committee regular input from stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Executive Compensation
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We ask that you approve, on an advisory basis, the compensation of our named executive officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The named executive officers are those executive officers listed in the Summary Compensation Table.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The advisory approval of named executive officer compensation is required by federal law, and while the vote is not binding, the Compensation Committee considers the vote as part of its evaluation of executive compensation programs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2016 Executive Compensation Highlights
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2016, our management team continued to execute on its strategy of providing our clients  individual investors, registered investment advisors and employers  with advice and services to help them achieve their financial goals.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This Through Clients Eyes strategy, combined with ongoing expense discipline, resulted in core net new assets of $125.5 billion (the fifth consecutive year in excess of $100 billion), total client assets of $2.78 trillion, and a pre-tax profit margin of 40.0%.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Earnings per share (EPS) was $1.31 (up 27% over the prior year), and return on common equity (ROCE) was 14%, the highest in seven years.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The companys compensation programs are designed to link pay to the long-term performance of the company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Key elements of 2016 compensation included:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Element    Form    Terms    Objectives Base Salary        Cash        Reviewedannually        Attract,motivate and retain executives Annual Incentives        Cash        Subjectto satisfaction of performance criteria        Attract,motivate and retain executives       Rewardexecutives for individual performance       Linkpay with company financial performance Long-Term Incentives        Performance-basedrestricted stock units       Stockoptions       Special2013 cash Long-Term Incentive Plan (LTIP)        Restrictedstock units with cliff- vesting based on a three-year performance period, subject to satisfaction of performance criteria       Stockoptions generally vest 25% per year and have a ten-year term       Special2013 Cash LTIP was based on cumulative earnings per share over a four-year performance period        Attract,motivate and retain executives       Rewardexecutives for individual performance       Linkpay with company financial performance       Alignwith long-term interests of stockholders
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: iv
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Execution on the companys strategy led to solid financial performance in 2016, and the Compensation Committee approved funding at 104.8% of the target award for the named executive officers for annual cash incentives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The performance goal for performance-based restricted stock units (PBRSUs) granted in 2016 was based on ROCE divided by cost of equity capital (COE) to align the executives incentives with the long-term interests of stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The PBRSUs have cliff-vesting based on a three- year performance period.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: PROXY STATEMENT
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board of Directors is sending these proxy materials to you on or about March 30, 2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stockholders who owned the companys common stock at the close of business on March 17, 2017 may attend and vote at the annual meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each share is entitled to one vote.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: There were 1,336,792,053 shares of common stock outstanding on March 17, 2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: VOTING YOUR SHARES
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Please vote as promptly as possible by following the instructions on your proxy card or voting instruction form.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: You may vote by internet, telephone or mail in advance of the meeting by following the instructions on your proxy card or voting instruction form.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you do not vote in advance and plan to submit your vote at the annual meeting, you will need a legal proxy to vote your shares if your shares are held in street name (e.g., through a bank or broker).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: You may obtain a legal proxy from your bank or broker.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you plan to vote at the virtual meeting, please send your legal proxy to our transfer agent, Wells Fargo Bank, N.A., by fax to (651) 450-4026 or email to wfssproxyteam@wellsfargo.com.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you plan to vote at the in-person meeting, please bring the legal proxy with you.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you hold shares registered in your name (e.g., in certificate form), you will not need a legal proxy to vote your shares at the annual meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: ATTENDING THE ANNUAL MEETING
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: You must register in advance to attend the annual meeting virtually via the internet or in person.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To register, please go to:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: www.schwabevents.com/corporation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: You will be asked to provide your name, mailing address, email address and proof that you own Schwab shares (such as the Schwab account number in which you hold the shares, or the name of the broker and number of shares that you hold in an account outside of Schwab).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: You also may write the Assistant Corporate Secretary at the address in the Corporate Governance Information section of this proxy statement or call the Assistant Corporate Secretary at (415) 667-9979 if you plan to attend the in-person meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you register in advance to attend the virtual annual meeting, we will email you information on how to access the area of www.schwabevents.com where you will be able to submit questions and vote.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: While you may watch the webcast without registering in advance, you will not be able to access the area of the website where you can ask questions and vote.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you plan to attend the in-person meeting, in accordance with our security procedures, you will be asked to present picture identification to enter the meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Attendance at the annual meeting is limited to stockholders or one named representative of a stockholder.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Seating is limited and, therefore, admission to the in-person annual meeting is on a first-come, first-served basis.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you will be naming a representative to attend the meeting on your behalf, the name, address and telephone number of that individual also must be provided.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Biographical information about each of the companys directors, including the director nominees, is contained in the following section.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: MEMBERS OF THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: JOHN K. ADAMS, JR.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: DIRECTOR SINCE 2015
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Adams, age 61, served as managing director in the Financial Institutions Group at UBS Investment Bank, a financial services firm, from 2002 until 2013.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Prior to joining UBS, Mr. Adams was with Credit Suisses Financial Institutions Group from 1985 until 2002.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: He currently serves on the board of directors of Charles Schwab Bank and Navient Corporation, a loan management, servicing and asset recovery company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Adams term expires in 2019.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Adams has significant experience with respect to the financial services industry, investment banking, capital markets and mergers and acquisitions, having served as head of UBS North American banks practice and in Credit Suisses Financial Institutions Group.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: NANCY H. BECHTLE DIRECTOR SINCE 1992
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Ms. Bechtle, age 79, served as President and Chief Executive Officer of the San Francisco Symphony from 1987 until 2001 and has served as a member of the San Francisco Symphony Board of Governors since 1984.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: She was a director and Chief Financial Officer of J.R. Bechtle & Co., an international consulting firm, from 1979 to 1998.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Ms. Bechtle served as Chairman and a director of Sugar Bowl Corporation, a ski resort operator, from 1998 to 2015, where she currently serves as Vice Chairman.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: She was appointed a director of the Presidio Trust in 2008 and served as its Chairman through 2015.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: She also served as a director of the National Park Foundation from 2002 until 2008 and was its Vice Chairman from 2005 until 2008.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Ms. Bechtles term expires in 2018.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Ms. Bechtle brings leadership skills and financial experience to the board, having served as Chief Financial Officer of J.R. Bechtle & Co., Chairman of Sugar Bowl Corporation and Chief Executive Officer of the San Francisco Symphony.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: She has deep knowledge of the company and its business, having served on the board since 1992.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: WALTER W. BETTINGER II DIRECTOR SINCE 2008
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Bettinger, age 56, has served as President and Chief Executive Officer of The Charles Schwab Corporation and a member of the Board of Directors since 2008.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: He also serves as a member of the Board of Directors of Charles Schwab Bank and Charles Schwab & Co., Inc., and as a trustee of The Charles Schwab Family of Funds, Schwab Investments, Schwab Capital Trust, Schwab Annuity Portfolios, Laudus Trust, Laudus Institutional Trust, and Schwab Strategic Trust, all registered investment companies.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Prior to assuming his current role, he served as President and Chief Operating Officer of the company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: He also served as Executive Vice President and President  Schwab Investor Services from 2005 until 2007, Executive Vice President and Chief Operating Officer  Individual Investor Enterprise from 2004 until 2005, Executive Vice President and President  Corporate Services from 2002 until 2004 and Executive Vice President and President  Retirement Plan Services from 2000 until 2002.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Bettinger joined the company in 1995 as part of the acquisition of The Hampton Company, which he founded in 1983.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Bettingers term expires in 2018.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Bettinger has significant financial services experience, having served in a senior executive role overseeing sales, service, marketing, and operations.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As Chief Executive Officer of the company, Mr. Bettinger works closely with the Board of Directors in evaluating and enhancing the strategic position of the company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: C. PRESTON BUTCHER DIRECTOR SINCE 1988
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Butcher, age 78, has been Chairman and Chief Executive Officer of Legacy Partners (formerly Lincoln Property Company N.C., Inc.), a real estate development and management firm, since 1998 and Chairman of the Board and Director of KBS Legacy Partners Apartment REIT, Inc., a real estate investment trust, since 2009 and had been Chief Executive Officer until 2012.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Butcher served as President, Chief Executive Officer and Regional Partner of Lincoln Property Company N.C., Inc. from 1967 until 1998.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: He served as a director of Northstar Realty Finance Corp until September 2014.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Butchers term expires in 2018.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Butcher brings leadership skills and experience in complex financial transactions to the board as Chairman and Chief Executive Officer of Legacy Partners.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: He has deep knowledge of the company and its business, having served on the board since 1988.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: CHRISTOPHER V. DODDS
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: DIRECTOR SINCE 2014
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Dodds, age 57, has served as a senior advisor at The Carlyle Group, a private equity firm, since 2008.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: He also serves on the Board of Directors of Charles Schwab Bank.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: From 1986 to 2007, Mr. Dodds held several key positions at The Charles Schwab Corporation, including Executive Vice President and Chief Financial Officer.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Dodds term expires in 2018.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Dodds brings leadership skills, knowledge of the financial services industry, and financial and accounting experience.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: He has deep knowledge of the company and its business, having served as its Chief Financial Officer from 1999 until 2007, and as a director of Charles Schwab Bank since 2007.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: STEPHEN A. ELLIS DIRECTOR SINCE 201
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Ellis, age 54, is a Managing Partner of TPG Capital, a private equity and alternative investment firm.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Prior to joining TPG Capital in 2015, Mr. Ellis served as Chief Executive Officer of Asurion, LLC, a provider of consumer technology protection services, from 2012 through 2014.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Prior to Asurion, Mr. Ellis served as Worldwide Managing Director of Bain & Company, a management consulting firm, from 2005 until 2012, and as Managing Partner for Bains West Coast offices from 1999 through 2004.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Ellis joined Bain in 1993.

sentences.text: DIRECTOR INDEPENDENCE
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We have considered the independence of each member of the board in accordance with New York Stock Exchange corporate governance standards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To assist us in our determination, we have general guidelines for independence.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The guidelines for independence are available on the companys website at www.aboutschwab.com/governance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Based on our guidelines and New York Stock Exchange corporate governance standards, we have determined that the following directors are independent: John K. Adams, Jr., Nancy H. Bechtle, C. Preston Butcher, Christopher V. Dodds, Stephen A. Ellis, Mark A. Goldfarb, William S. Haraf, Frank C. Herringer, Stephen T. McLin, Arun Sarin, Paula A. Sneed, Roger O. Walther, and Robert N. Wilson.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In determining independence, the Board of Directors considers broadly all relevant facts and circumstances regarding a directors relationships with the company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All non-employee directors receive compensation from the company for their service as a director, as disclosed in the section Director Compensation, and are entitled to receive reimbursement for their expenses in traveling to and participating in board and committee meetings.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As disclosed in the Transactions with Related Persons section of this proxy statement, some directors and entities with which they are affiliated have credit transactions with the companys banking and brokerage subsidiaries, such as mortgage loans, revolving lines of credit, or other extensions of credit.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These transactions with directors and their affiliates are made in the ordinary course of business and as permitted by the Sarbanes-Oxley Act of 2002.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Such transactions are on substantially the same terms, including interest rates and collateral, as those prevailing at the time for comparable transactions with persons not related to the lender and do not involve more than the normal risk of collectability or present other unfavorable features.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition to the relationships outlined above, the board considered the following types of relationships for the following directors:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Nancy H. Bechtle: The directors spouse serves as a director of a nonprofit organization to which the company, its affiliates or its charitable foundation have made donations.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: C. Preston Butcher: The directors spouse serves as a director of a nonprofit organization to which the company, its affiliates or its charitable foundation have made donations.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: CORPORATE GOVERNANCE INFORMATION
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Board Leadership
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Chairman of the Board is Charles R. Schwab.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Chairman and Chief Executive Officer roles are split, and Mr. Bettinger serves as Chief Executive Officer.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Chairman of the Board approves the agenda for board meetings and leads the board in its discussions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Schwab and Mr. Bettinger, as the only two management directors, do not participate in sessions of non-management directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As provided in our Corporate Governance Guidelines, non-management directors meet regularly in executive session without management.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Chairman of the Nominating and Corporate Governance Committee presides over the executive sessions of non-management directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Herringer, as Chairman of the Nominating and Corporate Governance Committee, leads the non-management directors in executive session.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The board has four standing committees (Audit, Compensation, Nominating and Corporate Governance, and Risk) that are composed entirely of independent directors and are chaired by independent directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Given the role and scope of authority of these committees, and that over 85% of the board is composed of independent directors, the board believes that its leadership structure, with the Chairman of the Board leading board discussions, and the Chairman of the Nominating and Corporate Governance Committee leading non-management executive sessions, is appropriate.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Risk Oversight
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As part of its oversight functions, the Board of Directors is responsible for oversight of risk management at the company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The board has a Risk Committee, which assists the board in fulfilling its oversight responsibilities with respect to the companys risk management program and provides reports to the board and the Audit Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee reviews reports from management and the Risk Committee concerning the companys risk assessment and major risk exposures and the steps management has taken to monitor and control such exposures.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee, as described in the Compensation Discussion and Analysis, separately reviews the compensation program with respect to the potential impact of risk-taking by employees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For further discussion of risk management at the company, please see Part II, Item 7, Managements Discussion and Analysis of Financial Condition and Results of Operations  Risk Management of the companys Form 10-K for the period ended December 31, 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Board Structure and Committees
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The authorized number of directors is currently fifteen and the company has fifteen directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Five directors are nominees for election this year and ten directors will continue to serve the terms described in their biographies.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Directors currently serve staggered terms.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each director who is elected at an annual meeting of stockholders serves a three-year term, and the directors are divided into three classes.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The board held seven meetings in 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each director attended at least 75% of all applicable board and committee meetings during 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As provided in our Corporate Governance Guidelines, we expect directors to attend the annual meeting of stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2016, fourteen of the fifteen directors attended the annual meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We have an Audit Committee, Compensation Committee, Nominating and Corporate Governance Committee, and Risk Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each of these committees is composed entirely of independent directors as determined by the Board of Directors in accordance with its independence guidelines and New York Stock Exchange corporate
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: governance standards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition to those standing committees, the board may from time to time establish ad hoc committees to assist in various matters.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee held twelve meetings in 2016 and is composed of the following members: Mark A. Goldfarb (Chairman), John K. Adams, Jr., C. Preston Butcher, Christopher V. Dodds, Stephen A. Ellis, and William S. Haraf.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: None of the directors on the Audit Committee is or, during the past three years, has been an employee of The Charles Schwab Corporation or any of its subsidiaries.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: None of the Audit Committee members simultaneously serves on the audit committees of more than three public companies, including ours.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The board has determined that all of the members of the Audit Committee are financially literate in accordance with New York Stock Exchange listing standards and that Mark A. Goldfarb, John K. Adams, Jr., Christopher V. Dodds and William S. Haraf are Audit Committee financial experts in accordance with Securities and Exchange Commission rules.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: reviews and discusses with management and the independent auditors the companys annual and quarterly financial statements and the integrity of the financial reporting process,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: reviews the qualifications, independence and performance of the independent auditors,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: reviews the activities and performance of the internal auditors,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: reviews reports from management and the Risk Committee regarding major risk exposures and steps management has taken to address such exposures, and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: reviews compliance with legal and regulatory requirements.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee held seven meetings in 2016 and is composed of the following members: Roger O. Walther (Chairman), Nancy H. Bechtle, Frank C. Herringer, Paula A. Sneed, and Robert N. Wilson.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: annually reviews and approves corporate goals and objectives relating to compensation of executive officers and other senior officers,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: evaluates the performance of executive officers and other senior officers and determines their compensation levels,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: reviews and approves compensatory arrangements for executive officers and other senior officers, and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: approves long-term awards for executive officers and other senior officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Nominating and Corporate Governance Committee held one meeting in 2016 and is composed of the following members: Frank C. Herringer (Chairman), John K. Adams, Jr., Nancy H. Bechtle, C. Preston Butcher, Christopher V. Dodds, Stephen A. Ellis, Mark A. Goldfarb, William S. Haraf, Stephen T. McLin, Arun Sarin, Paula A. Sneed, Roger O. Walther and Robert N. Wilson.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Nominating and Corporate Governance Committee:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: identifies and evaluates individuals qualified to serve on the board,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: recommends nominees to fill vacancies on the board and each board committee and recommends a slate of nominees for election or re-election as directors by the stockholders,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: makes recommendations regarding succession planning for the Chief Executive Officer and executive management, and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: assesses the performance of the board and its committees and recommends corporate governance principles for adoption by the board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Risk Committee held six meetings in 2016 and is composed of the following members: Christopher V. Dodds (Chairman), John K Adams, Jr., William S. Haraf, Stephen T. McLin, Arun Sarin and Robert N. Wilson.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Risk Committee:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: reviews and approves the companys risk governance structure to identify, measure, monitor and mitigate risks
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: reviews and approves the companys enterprise-wide risk management framework,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: reviews the performance and activities of the companys risk management organization, and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: reviews and approves key policies with respect to oversight of specific risks, including credit, compliance, liquidity, market, and operational risk, and capital.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee, Compensation Committee, Nominating and Corporate Governance Committee, and Risk Committee have written charters.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: You may find a copy of these charters, as well as our Corporate Governance Guidelines and Code of Business Conduct and Ethics, on the companys website at www.aboutschwab.com/governance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: You also may obtain a paper copy of these items, without charge, from:

sentences.text: DIRECTOR COMPENSATION
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Schwab and Mr. Bettinger, who are employed by the company, receive no additional compensation for their service as directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2016, non-employee directors received the following cash retainers and equity grants:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Cash Retainers
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each non-employee director received an annual cash retainer in the amount of $100,000.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, the Chairs of the Audit Committee and Risk Committee received an annual cash retainer of $35,000, and each other member of the Audit Committee and Risk Committee received an annual cash retainer of $15,000.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Chair of the Compensation Committee received an annual cash retainer of $30,000, and each other member of the Compensation Committee received an annual cash retainer of $10,000.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Chair of the Nominating and Corporate Governance Committee received an annual cash retainer of $25,000, and each other member of the Nominating and Corporate Governance Committee received an annual cash retainer of $10,000.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: There are no fees for attendance at board or committee meetings, but the board retains the discretion to establish special committees and to pay a special retainer to the Chair and the members of any special committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Equity Grants
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each non-employee director received an annual equity grant under the 2013 Stock Incentive Plan with an aggregate value of $140,000 Non-employee directors received this equity grant 50% in stock options and 50% in restricted stock units (RSUs).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Terms and Conditions
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Non-employee directors receive the annual grants of options and RSUs on the second business day after the annual meeting of stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In the event a new non-employee director is elected to the board during the year, a pro-rata
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: amount of cash retainers and equity awards is granted to that individual for the first calendar year in lieu of the full amount.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The non-employee director equity grants are subject to the following terms and conditions:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The annual grants of options and RSUs vest over the three-year period following the grant date, with 25% vesting on each of the first and second anniversary of the grant date and the remaining 50% on the third anniversary of the grant date.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The options and RSUs become 100% vested in the event of the non-employee directors death, disability or retirement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The number of RSUs for the annual grant is determined by dividing 50% of the aggregate value of the annual equity grant by the average of the high and low market price of the companys common stock on the grant date.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The number of options for the annual grant of stock options is determined by dividing 50% of the aggregate value of the annual equity grant by the fair value of an option on the grant date.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each stock option is designated as a nonqualified stock option and has an exercise price equal to the fair market value of common stock on the grant date.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each stock option expires on the earliest of (1) the date ten years after the grant date, (2) the date three months after termination of service for any reason other than death, disability or retirement, or (3) the date one year after termination of service because of death or disability.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The company also has stock ownership guidelines for non-employee directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under our guidelines, each non-employee director should own company stock with a fair market value equal to or exceeding $400,000.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A new director should reach this target level upon completing five years of service.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Once this target level is reached, the director is deemed to meet this target so long as he or she continues to hold an equivalent number of shares as on the date the target level was met.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Shares owned outright, deferred shares and RSUs are counted in determining the threshold under our stock ownership guidelines, but stock options are not.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Directors Deferred Compensation Plan
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Non-employee directors also may participate in the Directors Deferred Compensation Plan II.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This plan allows them to defer receipt of all or a portion of their cash retainers and, at their election, either to:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (1) receive stock options that:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: have a fair value equal to the amounts deferred (as determined under the valuation method used by the company to value stock options at the time of the deferral),
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: have an option exercise price equal to the closing price of common stock on the date the deferred amount would have been paid, and

sentences.text: DIRECTOR NOMINATIONS
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Nominating and Corporate Governance Committee recommended all of the nominees for election included in this years proxy statement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board of Directors appointed Mr. Haraf as a director effective January 29, 2015, and this is the first time he is standing for election since his appointment.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Haraf was originally recommended to the Nominating and Corporate Governance Committee as a potential director by the Chief Executive Officer and other executive management.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Nominating and Corporate Governance Committee, comprised of independent directors, recommended Mr. Harafs nomination as a candidate.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Nominating and Corporate Governance Committee has a policy to consider candidates recommended by stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The policy provides that stockholder recommendations must be in writing and include the following information:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) the name, address and contact information of the recommending stockholder;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) proof of the stockholders share ownership;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iii) a resume or statement of he candidates qualifications; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iv) a statement of the stockholders relationship with the proposed candidate or interest in the proposed candidacy.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The written recommendation must be addressed to the Assistant Corporate Secretary at the address provided in he Corporate Governance Information section of this proxy statement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Diversity
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: When identifying director nominees, the board considers the qualifications and skills represented on the board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As discussed in the Director Qualifications section below, one of the considerations evaluated by the board is the diversity of experience and background of directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This consideration is broad, is consistent with our companys non-discrimination policies, and includes diversity of skill sets and experience as well as background, including race and gender.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Nominating and Corporate Governance Committee annually reviews the structure and size of the board to assure that the proper skills are represented on the board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This assessment includes the effectiveness of board composition, including the qualifications, skills, and diversity represented on the board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Director Qualifications
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The qualifications for directors are described in our Corporate Governance Guidelines, which are available on the companys website at www.aboutschwab.com/governance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, the Nominating and Corporate Governance Committee believes that the followin specific, minimum qualifications must be met by a nominee for the position of director:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: the ability to work together with other directors, with full and open discussion and debate as an effective group,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: current knowledge and experience in the companys business or operations, or contacts in the community in which the company does business and in the industries relevant to the companys business, or substantial business, financial or industry-related experience, and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: the willingness and ability to devote adequate time to the companys business.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The committee also considers the following qualities and skills when making its determination whether a nominee is qualified for the position of director:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: relationships that may affect the independence of the director or conflicts of interest that may affect the directors ability  discharge his or her duties,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: diversity of experience and background, including the need for financial, business, academic, public sector and other expertise on the board or board committees, and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: the fit of the individuals skills and experience with those of the other directors and potential directors in comparison to the needs of the company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: When evaluating a candidate for nomination, the committee does not assign specific weight to any of these factors or believe that all of the criteria necessarily apply to every candidate.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Identifying and Evaluating Candidates for Director
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Nominating and Corporate Governance Committee reviews the appropriate skills and characteristics required of board members in the context of the current composition of the board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Candidates considered for nomination to the Board of Directors may come from several sources, including current and former directors, professional search firms and stockholder recommendations.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Nominees for director are evaluated, in consultation with the companys Chairman, by the committee, which may retain the services of a professional search firm to assist it in identifying or evaluating potential candidates.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you wish to communicate with the board, the Chairman of the Nominating and Corporate Governance Committee, or with the independent directors as a group, you may send your communication in writing to the Assistant Corporate Secretary at the address provided in the Corporate Governance Information section of this proxy statement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: You must include your name and address in the written communication and indicate whether you are a stockholder of the company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Assistant Corporate Secretary will compile all communications, summarize lengthy, repetitive or duplicative communications and forward them to the appropriate director or directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Assistant Corporate Secretary will not forward non-substantive communications or communications that pertain to personal grievances, but instead will forward them to the appropriate department within the company for resolution.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In such cases, the Assistant Corporate Secretary will retain a copy of such communication for review by any director upon his or her request.

sentences.text: PROPOSAL TWO: RATIFICATION OF THE SELECTION OF INDEPENDENT AUDITORS
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee has the sole authority to hire, retain and terminate the independent auditors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The independent auditors report directly to the Audit Committee, and the Audit Committee is directly responsible for oversight of the work of the independent auditors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee oversees fees paid to the independent auditors and pre-approves all audit, internal control-related and permitted non-audit services to be performed by the independent auditors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee evaluates the qualifications, performance and independence of the independent auditors, including the rotation and selection of the lead audit partner and whether it is appropriate to rotate the audit firm itself.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee has selected Deloitte & Touche LLP and the member firms of Deloitte Touche Tohmatsu (collectively referred to as Deloitte) as the companys independent registered public accounting firm for the 2017 fiscal year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Deloitte has served in this capacity since the companys inception.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee and the Board of Directors believe that the retention of Deloitte for the 2017 fiscal year is in the best interests of the company and its stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Although we are not required to submit the selection of the independent auditors to stockholders, we are asking for your ratification as part of the Audit Committees evaluation process of the independent registered public accounting firm for the next fiscal year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We expect representatives of Deloitte to attend the annual meeting of stockholders, where they will respond to appropriate questions from stockholders and have the opportunity to make a statement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Non-Audit Services Policies and Procedures
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee has adopted a policy regarding non-audit services performed by Deloitte.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committees policy prohibits engaging Deloitte to perform the following services:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: any contingent fee arrangement,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: bookkeeping or other services relating to accounting records or financial statements of the audit client,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: broker-dealer services,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: actuarial services,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: management and human resource functions (including executive search services),
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: legal services and expert services unrelated to the audit,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: appraisal and valuation services, fairness opinions or contribution-in-kind reports,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: internal audit outsourcing,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: financial information systems design and implementation,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: tax consulting or advice or a tax opinion on an aggressive tax position or on a listed transaction or a confidential transaction as defined by U.S. Department of Treasury regulations, and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: tax services to employees who have a financial reporting oversight role.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The policy requires the pre-approval of the Audit Committee for other non-audit services performed by Deloitte.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The policy divides non-audit services into three separate categories, which the Audit Committee has pre-approved subject to an annual aggregate dollar limit for each category.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Once the dollar limit in each of these three categories is reached, the Audit Committee will decide whether to establish an additional spending limit for the category or specifically pre-approve each additional service in the category for the remainder of the year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The three categories are:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: accounting theory consultation (includes services such as guidance on the application of Generally Accepted Accounting Principles to various transactions and guidance on the effects of new accounting pronouncements),
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: assurance and due diligence (includes services such as certain reports on internal controls, review of Securities and Exchange Commission filings, merger and acquisition due diligence, employee benefit plan audits, and foreign statutory audits and regulatory reports), and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: tax return review, preparation and compliance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Services not subject to pre-approval limits in one of the three categories above require specific pre-approval from the Audit Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Fees related to services requiring specific pre-approval are limited, on an annual basis, to 50% of the combination of audit fees, audit-related fees and tax fees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The policy permits the Audit Committee to delegate pre-approval authority to one or more members of the Audit Committee, provided that the member or members report to the entire Audit Committee pre-approval actions taken since the last Audit Committee meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The policy expressly prohibits delegation of pre-approval authority to management.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In fiscal years 2016 and 2015, the Audit Committee pre-approved 100% of the services performed by Deloitte relating to audit-related fees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: PROPOSAL THREE: FREQUENCY OF ADVISORY VOTE ON NAMED EXECUTIVE OFFICER COMPENSATION
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: You will have the opportunity this year to indicate your preference on the frequency of having advisory votes on named executive officer compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: You may indicate your preference to have the advisory vote every one, two or three years, or you may abstain from voting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The vote on the frequency of advisory votes on named executive officer compensation is required by federal law at least once every six years, and we last held a vote on the frequency of advisory votes in 2011.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Although it is not binding, the Board of Directors has a policy that it will submit the advisory vote on named executive officer compensation to stockholders in accordance with the frequency that receives a majority of votes cast on the proposal.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If none of the options regarding voting frequency receives a majority, the board will submit the advisory vote with such frequency as determined by the board in accordance with its best judgment.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2011, the board recommended, and stockholders voted for, a preference of a frequency of one year to conduct an advisory vote on named executive officer compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The board again recommends a frequency of one year, as we believe that having an advisory vote every year on named executive officer compensation provides the Compensation Committee regular input from stockholders and is an element to be considered as part of its broader review of executive compensation programs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents

sentences.text: COMPENSATION DISCUSSION AND ANALYSIS
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: EXECUTIVE SUMMARY
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This Compensation Discussion and Analysis describes the companys executive compensation program, policies and practices, which are designed to support the companys strategic objectives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Key Business Results
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our business strategy focuses on providing clients  individual investors, registered investment advisors and employers  with advice and services to help them achieve their financial goals.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: By seeing business through clients eyes and offering them a compelling combination of personalized relationships, superior service and great value, the company seeks to build enduring client loyalty.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Loyal clients bring us more business and refer their friends, colleagues and family.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: By operating the business in a disciplined manner and leveraging shared processes and technology, we are able to invest in new products and services for clients and deliver a meaningful return to stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Schwabs Through Clients Eyes strategy remains the driver of our growth.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Effective execution of this strategy helped us succeed with clients throughout 2016 as they faced a challenging and eventful investing environment.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Core net new assets of $125.5 billion marked the fifth consecutive year in excess of $100 billion and a 5% annual organic growth rate.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We ended the year with 10.2 million active brokerage accounts and 1.1 million banking accounts, up 4% and 7%, respectively, over year-end 2015.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Clients entrusted $2.78 trillion in assets to us as of December 31, 2016, up 11% over year-end 2015.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Of these assets, approximately half ($1.40 trillion) were receiving some form of ongoing advisory service, up 12%: $1.18 trillion were under the guidance of an independent advisor and $217 billion in client assets were enrolled in one of our retail advisory solutions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Success with clients combined with our ongoing expense discipline in 2016 led to record financial performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Net revenues of $7.5 billion were up 17% over year-end 2015, and net income of $1.9 billion was up 31% over year-end 2015   both amounts are records for the firm.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Revenue growth was 790 basis points higher than our 9% expense growth during the year
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Pre-tax profit margin of 40.0% was up 4.3 percentage points over the prior year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Earnings per share (EPS) of $1.31 was up 27% over the prior year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Return on common equity was 14%, the highest in seven years.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Execution on this strategy produced outstanding financial results in 2016, including meaningful operating leverage, as even the minimal increase in interest rates during the year enabled the Company to make significant progress in rebuilding its earnings power.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A more thorough discussion of the companys business and business strategy is provided in our Annual Report on Form 10-K.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Executive Compensation Program
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our executive compensation program is intended to support the companys success by:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: attracting, motivating and retaining talented, highly capable executive officers,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: rewarding executives for individual performance,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: linking executive pay with the companys financial performance, and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: aligning incentives for executive officers with the interests of the company and its stockholders by linking pay with longer-term performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our compensation program uses three elements  base salary, annual cash incentives and long-term incentive awards (LTI)  to achieve these objectives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As illustrated by the charts below, the majority of compensation is delivered through variable performance- based incentives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This approach maintains a strong link between executive pay and the companys financial performance, only rewards executives when value has been created for stockholders, and drives long-term performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2016, variable pay increased with the payment of special cash long-term incentive awards granted in 2013 (2013 Cash LTIP) to address retention issues and motivate key talent to achieve our long-term strategic goals during a period of unique challenges in the financial services industry.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The 2013 Cash LTIP payments were based on the companys long-term financial performance as measured by cumulative EPS for the four-year performance period ending December 31, 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2016 CEO Pay Mix   2016 Average Pay Mix of All Other Named Executive Officers   *
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: * Pay mix is based on amounts in the Summary Compensation Table.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Annual cash incentive is the amount reported for the Corporate Executive Bonus Plan under Non-Equity Incentive Plan Compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Long-term Incentive Awards are amounts reported for the 2013 Cash LTIP under Non-Equity Incentive Plan Compensation, Stock Awards and Option Awards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Key Compensation Decisions
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The companys commitment to disciplined execution of its business strategy has delivered solid financial results in the years since the onset of the financial crisis of 2008.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2016, in a challenging and eventful environment, the company drove strong business growth through its innovative, full-service model that continued to resonate with clients.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Strong business growth and the companys overall spending discipline led to outstanding financial performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committees decisions for 2016 aligned with this disciplined focus on financial results.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2016, the Compensation Committee:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Continued to use EPS as the performance criterion for the Corporate Executive Bonus Plan because it measures profitability and focuses executive officers on operating performance and decisions around capital structure.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Set the target EPS goal for 100% payout upon achieving the companys financial plan approved by the board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Approved annual cash incentive payouts under the Corporate Executive Bonus Plan of 104.8% of the target set by the Compensation Committee based on the companys financial performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Awarded performance-based restricted stock units (PBRSUs) with cliff-vesting based on a three-year performance period to ensure continued focus on long-term performance and retention.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Continued to use return on common equity (ROCE) equaling or exceeding cost of equity (COE) as the performance goal for the 2016 PBRSUs, because it reflects the creation of financial value for stockholders in all phases of the business cycle and measures the earnings power of the company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: COMPENSATION PLANNING AND THE DECISION-MAKING PROCESS
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee reviews and approves compensation for the Chairman, the Chief Executive Officer, executive officers, and other senior officers, and it reviews and recommends to the Board of Directors compensation for the non-employee directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee evaluates as a committee, or together with the other independent directors and the Chairman, the performance and compensation of the Chief Executive Officer.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee also considers:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: recommendations from the Chairman and the Chief Executive Officer regarding compensation for the other executive officers and performance criteria for annual and long-term incentives, developed in consultation with the Executive Vice President  Human Resources,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: recommendations from the Chief Financial Officer regarding performance criteria and goals for annual and long-term incentives,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: advice from the Executive Vice President  Corporate Risk regarding the design and results of incentive compensation programs to ensure consistency with the companys financial plan, strategic objectives and risk profile, and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: guidance and advice of its independent compensation consultant, Semler Brossy Consulting Group (Semler Brossy).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: While the Compensation Committee considers the information provided by management and its independent, third-party advisor, it does not delegate authority to management for executive compensation decisions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committees review of named executive officer compensation in January 2016 included consideration of:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: the economic environment, market trends, and proposed regulations,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: a competitive pay analysis of peer companies with data from proxy statements and the McLagan 2015 Top Management  Global survey,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: each executives experience, responsibilities, individual performance, and pay relative to internal peers, and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: reports prepared by the companys Human Resources Department on each executives pay history with:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: actual total compensation for 2012 to 2015,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: projected 2016 compensation,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: the value and vesting schedule of outstanding long-term awards,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: each component of pay as a percentage of total compensation, and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: option exercises, equity vesting amounts, dividend equivalents, 401(k) balances, deferred compensation balances, and other cash compensation (e.g., company match for the 401(k) plan and wellness incentives).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee does not use a formula or assign a weighting to various factors considered in setting compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: It does not target a specific percentage mix between cash compensation and long-term incentives or any specific percentage of total compensation for each compensation component.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee uses a peer group as a source of market data to assess the competitiveness of compensation and pay practices for executive officers and directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The data is not used to set compensation targets.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Peers were selected considering the following factors:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Quantitative: revenue, market capitalization, and number of employees
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Qualitative: business model, geographic coverage, and competition for customers and/or employees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Because the company has few competitors comparable in terms of business model and geographic coverage, the peer group includes a mix of brokerage firms, banking and asset management companies, and companies that provide custody services and process a significant daily volume of consumer financial transactions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The peer group of 23 companies used for compensation for 2016 was:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under its charter, the Compensation Committee is authorized to retain compensation consultants and to approve the terms of the engagement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2016, the Compensation Committee engaged Semler Brossy to review pay trends across the financial services industry and in the peer group, advise directly on Chief Executive Officer, Chairman and director compensation, provide competitive assessments of executive compensation, review the companys long-term incentives as well as the long-term incentives used by companies in the peer group, assist with the review and analysis of the peer group, and provide general advice and counsel with respect to executive compensation programs, market practices and trends.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Semler Brossy was engaged by the Compensation Committee directly and does not provide other services to the company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2016, the Compensation Committee reviewed information regarding potential conflicts of interest with Semler Brossy, including: other services it might provide to the company, fees received from the company as a percentage of its total revenue, policies and procedures designed to prevent conflicts of interest, any business and/or personal relationships with members of the Compensation Committee, company stock owned, and any business and/or personal relationships between Semler Brossy consultants and any executive officer of the company.

sentences.text: Base Salary
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Base salaries are established at levels intended to attract, motivate and retain highly capable executive officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As illustrated by the pay mix charts in the Executive Summary above, executive officers receive a small percentage of their overall compensation in base salary.

sentences.text: Annual Cash Incentives
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Annual cash incentive awards for the named executive officers were made pursuant to the Corporate Executive Bonus Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In the first quarter of 2016, the Compensation Committee established the performance criterion, set performance goals and approved a target bonus award, expressed as a percentage of salary, for each named executive officer.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: EPS was established as the performance criterion for all named executive officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee believes EPS provides a comprehensive measure of the companys profitability and focuses executive officers on operating performance and decisions around capital structure.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For purposes of the Corporate Executive Bonus Plan, EPS is calculated as fully diluted EPS calculated in accordance with U.S. Generally Accepted Accounting Principles, subject to categories of adjustments and exclusions approved by the Compensation Committee at the time the performance criterion was established.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: EPS goals were summarized in a matrix with potential payouts ranging from 50% to 200% of the target bonus award, with a 100% payout assigned to the EPS goal set by the Compensation Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Achieving EPS of less than 50% of the target EPS goal would result in no bonus payment; achieving EPS between 50% and 100% of the target EPS goal would result in a payout of between 50% and 100% of the target bonus award; and achieving EPS of more than the target EPS goal would result in a payout of between 100% and 200% of the target bonus award.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The threshold of 50% of target EPS was adopted to establish the minimum level of
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: achievement for a bonus payment and a cap on bonus payout was set at 200% of the target award.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: When determining whether the performance goals have been achieved, the Compensation Committee reviews unusual gains and losses and whether results have been achieved in a manner consistent with the companys risk profile.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Based on this review, the Compensation Committee may exercise discretion to reduce payouts.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2016, the target EPS goal was set at $1.25; the maximum payment was 200% of the target bonus award for EPS of $2.50 or higher; and the minimum payment was 50% of the target bonus award for EPS of $0.625.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The target EPS goal of $1.25 was set to result in a payout of 100% of the target bonus award for performance in line with the companys financial plans approved by the board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For 2016, the Compensation Committee approved payouts based on EPS of $1.31.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee determined that the company achieved these results while maintaining a low credit risk profile and remaining within its parameters for interest rate risk.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee did not reduce the cash incentive award for any individual named executive officer and approved funding at 104.8% of target for each of the named executive officers.

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: At its January 2016 meeting, the Compensation Committee approved equity awards to be granted on March 1, 2016 for the named executive officers pursuant to the 2013 Stock Incentive Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Of the total target equity awards granted, 50% was granted in stock options and 50% was granted in PBRSUs to align the incentives of executives with the long-term interests of stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This mix reflects a steady evolution over the past several years towards PBRSUs, moving from 30% PBRSUs in 2009, 2010 and 2011 to 40% in 2012, and 50% in 2013, 2014, 2015 and 2016.

sentences.text: Performance-Based Restricted Stock Units
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee approved PBRSUs with cliff-vesting based on the three-year performance period from January 1, 2016 to December 31, 2018.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The main features of the 2016 PBRSUs are summarized below.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Feature    Comments   Grant Date        March 1, 2016   Vesting Schedule        100% vesting on the third anniversary of the grant date   All vesting is subject to Compensation Committee certification that the performance goal for that period has been met   Performance Period        January 1, 2016 to December 31, 2018   Dividend Equivalent Payments        Dividend equivalent payments equal to the dividends paid on a share of company stock will accumulate and be paid in cash when, and if, the underlying units vest       If the performance goals for the units are not met, the dividend equivalent payments are forfeited   Payment        The number of shares of company stock payable upon vesting will vary based upon performance       200% of the target award is the maximum number of shares of company stock payable for each unit that vests   Performance Criteria        ROCE       COE
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee approved performance goals based on ROCE and COE with variable payouts where the number of shares payable is determined by dividing ROCE by COE and multiplying the result by the funding levels summarized in a matrix.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Shares are forfeited if the performance target is not met or paid in a range from 100% to 200% of the target award when performance equals or exceeds target.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee approved performance criteria based on ROCE and COE because it reflects the creation of financial value for stockholders in all phases of the business cycle and measures the earnings power of the company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The opportunity for a payout up to 200% of the target award incents executives to exceed target performance and directly links the magnitude of the payout o the companys performance up to a cap of 200%.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If the Compensation Committee certifies that the goal has been met for the performance period, then the award for that performance period will vest.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If the goal has not been met, then the PBRSUs and associated dividend equivalent payments will be forfeited with no second opportunity to be earned.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: ROCE is calculated as net income available to common stockholders divided by average common stockholders equity, for the applicable performance period, subject to categories of adjustments and exclusions approved by the Compensation Committee at the time the performance criteria were established.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: COE is calculated using the Capital Asset Pricing Model (CAP-M), which is a commonly used financial metric that incorporates the risk-free interest rate (the company uses the six-month average of the five-year Treasury rate), the beta of the companys equity (a measure of the volatility of the companys common stock relative to the broader equity market), and a market equity risk premium (an estimate of the expected excess return required for holding equities instead of a risk-free asset).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In determining whether the performance goals have been met, the Committee shall exclude losses from any unusual or non-recurring items including but not limited to: discontinued operations; the cumulative negative effects of
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: changes in accounting principles and laws; losses on divestitures; losses on foreign exchange transactions; impairment of goodwill, intangible or long-lived assets; litigation-related charges; restructuring charges; and any other unusual or non-recurring losses.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee chose ROCE compared to COE as a criterion that reflects the creation of financial value for stockholders in all phases of the business cycle and measures the earnings power of the company.

sentences.text: In January 2013, the Compensation Committee established a cash long-term incentive program pursuant to the 2004 Stock Incentive Plan and granted the 2013 Cash LTIP awards to address retention issues during a time when the company and the financial services industry faced unique challenges, including among others, sustained historically low interest rates.

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee granted individual awards payable based on the companys performance as measured by cumulative EPS for the four-year performance period ending on December 31, 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee selected cumulative EPS as the performance criterion because it provides a comprehensive measure of the companys profitability and focuses executive officers on operating performance and capital management over the four-year performance period.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For purposes of the 2013 Cash LTIP, cumulative EPS is calculated as fully diluted EPS for net income calculated in accordance with U.S. Generally Accepted Accounting Principles, subject to categories of adjustments and exclusions approved by the Compensation Committee at the time the performance criterion was established.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Cumulative EPS goals were summarized in a matrix with potential payouts for the 2013 Cash LTIP ranging from 0% to 200% of the target award, with a 100% payout assigned to a cumulative EPS goal set by the Compensation Committee based on the companys four-year projections for EPS at the time the awards were granted.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: would result in a payout of between 100% and 200% of the target.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stock Ownership Guidelines
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board of Directors has adopted stock ownership guidelines to promote significant equity ownership by executives and further align their long-term financial interests with those of other stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under the guidelines:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Chief Executive Officer is expected to maintain an investment position in company stock equal to at least five times base salary
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All other executive officers are expected to maintain an investment position equal to at least three times base salary.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Shares owned directly, shares beneficially owned under company benefit plans, restricted stock, and restricted stock units are included in determining ownership levels, but stock options are not.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The stock ownership guidelines allow the Compensation Committee to take action if the target ownership levels are not met within five years.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For 2016, all of the named executive officers had stock ownership exceeding the guidelines.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Speculative trading in the companys stock is prohibited.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Prohibited speculative trading includes short-term trading, selling short, buying options to open a position and selling uncovered options.
